item.title: Vengeance
item.dc:creator: @redrover redrover
item.description:
@redrover wrote:

Ok, i’ve got i loot i his Taste vengeance works nicely but the timers are weird
When i put the timers on 0-0 They can mass it when i do it on 1 u need to wait like 1 hour?

This is the code

public void castvengeancenpc() // improved vengeance by I loot I on npc
{
	if(IsAttackingNPC && VenganceTimer == 0 && vegeance == true) {
	txt4 = "Taste vengeance !";
	string4UpdateRequired = true;
	startAnimation(1979);
	staticAnimation(401, absX, absY, 100);
	sendMessage("You have cast a perfect Vengeance !");
        vengNPC(14);
	addSkillXP((3700 * hitDiff), 6);
	addSkillXP((3700 * hitDiff), playerHitpoints);
	waittimer = 1;
	VenganceTimer = 0;
	vegeance = false;
	teleportToX = absX;
	teleportToY = absY;
	} else {
	sendMessage("An Error Has Occured In Ur Vengeance !");
	}
}

public void castvengeance() // improved vengeance by I loot I on players
{
	if(IsAttacking && VenganceTimer == 0 && vegeance == true && PlayerHandler.players[AttackingOn] != null) {
	txt4 = "Taste vengeance !";
	string4UpdateRequired = true;
	startAnimation(1979);
	staticAnimation(401, absX, absY, 100);
	sendMessage("You have cast a perfect Vengeance !");
	warnplayer2();
	PlayerHandler.players[AttackingOn].hitDiff = misc.random(14);
	PlayerHandler.players[AttackingOn].updateRequired = true;
	PlayerHandler.players[AttackingOn].hitUpdateRequired = true;
	waittimer = 1;
	VenganceTimer = 0;
	vegeance = false;
	teleportToX = absX;
	teleportToY = absY;
	} else {
	sendMessage("An Error Has Occured In Ur Vengeance !");
	}
}

public int VenganceTimer = 0;
public int waittimer = 0;

Read full topic
